prompt: <description>**Part 1: Construct a simple, white, three-dimensional cross with a flat base.** 1. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following parameters: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.1592, 0.0] 2. Next, create a 2D sketch on the XY plane of the new coordinate system. 3. Draw the following lines to create the base of the cross: - Line 1: Start Point [0.0, 0.4167], End Point [0.1688, 0.4167] - Line 2: Start Point [0.1688, 0.4167], End Point [0.1688, 0.0] - Line 3: Start Point [0.1688, 0.0], End Point [0.35, 0.0] - Line 4: Start Point [0.35, 0.0], End Point [0.35, 0.4167] - Line 5: Start Point [0.35, 0.4167], End Point [0.5146, 0.4167] - Line 6: Start Point [0.5146, 0.4167], End Point [0.5146, 0.5833] - Line 7: Start Point [0.5146, 0.5833], End Point [0.35, 0.5771] - Line 8: Start Point [0.35, 0.5771], End Point [0.35, 0.75] - Line 9: Start Point [0.35, 0.75], End Point [0.1688, 0.75] - Line 10: Start Point [0.1688, 0.75], End Point [0.1688, 0.5833] - Line 11: Start Point [0.1688, 0.5833], End Point [0.0, 0.5833] - Line 12: Start Point [0.0, 0.5833], End Point [0.0, 0.4167] 4. Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.75. 5. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D Sketch using the euler angles and translation vector from the coordinate system. 6. Extrude the 2D sketch along the Z-axis by 0.1592 units to create the 3D model of the cross. The dimensions of the cross are as follows: - Length: 0.75 units - Width: 0.1592 units - Height: 0.75 units</description>
completion:
<json>
{"parts":{"part_1":{"coordinate_system":{"Euler Angles":[0.0,0.0,-90.0],"Translation Vector":[0.0,0.1592,0.0]},"sketch":{"face_1":{"loop_1":{"line_1":{"Start Point":[0.0,0.4167],"End Point":[0.1688,0.4167]},"line_2":{"Start Point":[0.1688,0.4167],"End Point":[0.1688,0.0]},"line_3":{"Start Point":[0.1688,0.0],"End Point":[0.35,0.0]},"line_4":{"Start Point":[0.35,0.0],"End Point":[0.35,0.4167]},"line_5":{"Start Point":[0.35,0.4167],"End Point":[0.5146,0.4167]},"line_6":{"Start Point":[0.5146,0.4167],"End Point":[0.5146,0.5833]},"line_7":{"Start Point":[0.5146,0.5833],"End Point":[0.35,0.5771]},"line_8":{"Start Point":[0.35,0.5771],"End Point":[0.35,0.75]},"line_9":{"Start Point":[0.35,0.75],"End Point":[0.1688,0.75]},"line_10":{"Start Point":[0.1688,0.75],"End Point":[0.1688,0.5833]},"line_11":{"Start Point":[0.1688,0.5833],"End Point":[0.0,0.5833]},"line_12":{"Start Point":[0.0,0.5833],"End Point":[0.0,0.4167]}}}},"extrusion":{"extrude_depth_towards_normal":0.1592,"extrude_depth_opposite_normal":0.0,"sketch_scale":0.75,"operation":"NewBodyFeatureOperation"}}}}

prompt: <description>**Part 1: Rectangular Prism** Construct a rectangular prism. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with euler angles of 0.0, 0.0, 0.0 and a translation vector of 0.0, 0.0, 0.0. Draw a 2D sketch on the XY plane. 1. Begin with face_1 and draw loop_1. 2. Within loop_1, draw four lines: - line_1: Start Point (0.0, 0.0), End Point (0.5, 0.0) - line_2: Start Point (0.5, 0.0), End Point (0.5, 0.75) - line_3: Start Point (0.5, 0.75), End Point (0.0, 0.75) - line_4: Start Point (0.0, 0.75), End Point (0.0, 0.0) Loop_1 contains four lines with a total of four corners. Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.75. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D space using euler angles of 0.0, 0.0, 0.0 and a translation vector of 0.0, 0.0, 0.0. Extrude the 2D sketch by 0.3 units towards the normal and 0.0 units in the opposite direction of the normal. **Part 2: Cylindrical Cut** Create a cylindrical cut in the rectangular prism. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with euler angles of 0.0, 0.0, 0.0 and a translation vector of 0.0, 0.0, 0.3. Draw a 2D sketch on the XY plane. 1. Begin with face_1 and draw loop_1. 2. Within loop_1, draw four lines: - line_1: Start Point (0.0, 0.0), End Point (0.15, 0.0) - line_2: Start Point (0.15, 0.0), End Point (0.15, 0.75) - line_3: Start Point (0.15, 0.75), End Point (0.0, 0.75) - line_4: Start Point (0.0, 0.75), End Point (0.0, 0.0) Loop_1 contains four lines with a total of four corners. Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.75. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D space using euler angles of 0.0, 0.0, 0.0 and a translation vector of 0.0, 0.0, 0.0. Extrude the 2D sketch by 0.0 units towards the normal and 0.15 units in the opposite direction of the normal. **Part 3: Cylindrical Hole** Create a cylindrical hole in the previous carving. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with euler angles of 0.0, 0.0, 0.0 and a translation vector of 0.225, 0.275, 0.3. Draw a 2D sketch on the XY plane. 1. Begin with face_1 and draw loop_1. 2. Within loop_1, draw one circle: - circle_1: Center (0.1, 0.1), Radius 0.1 Loop_1 contains one circle. Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.2. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D space using euler angles of 0.0, 0.0, 0.0 and a translation vector of 0.0, 0.0, 0.0. Extrude the 2D sketch by 0.0 units towards the normal and 1.25 units in the opposite direction of the normal.</description>

prompt: <description>**Intermediate Part 1: A Rectangular Prism with a Curved Side** The first part is a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and a curved side. The length of the prism is approximately twice the width, and the height is about three times the width. The curved side is facing the viewer. **Step 1: Create a new coordinate system** Create a new coordinate system with the following properties: - Euler angles: (0.0, 0.0, -90.0) - Translation vector: (0.0, 0.0124, 0.0) **Step 2: Create the 2D sketch** Create a new 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the new coordinate system. **Step 3: Draw the curves and loops** *Curve 1:* - Start point: (0.0, 0.0) - End point: (0.0708, 0.0) *Curve 2:* - Start point: (0.0708, 0.0) - End point: (0.0708, 0.0425) *Curve 3:* - Start point: (0.0708, 0.0425) - End point: (0.1274, 0.0425) *Curve 4:* - Start point: (0.1274, 0.0425) - End point: (0.7358, 0.4685) *Curve 5:* - Start point: (0.7358, 0.4685) - End point: (0.7358, 0.5178) *Curve 6:* - Start point: (0.7358, 0.5178) - End point: (0.75, 0.5178) *Curve 7:* - Start point: (0.75, 0.5178) - End point: (0.75, 0.5821) *Curve 8:* - Start point: (0.75, 0.5821) - End point: (0.0, 0.0569) *Curve 9:* - Start point: (0.0, 0.0569) - End point: (0.0, 0.0) The sketch consists of one face, with the above nine curves arranged in a single loop. **Step 4: Create the 3D model** Extrude the 2D sketch along the normal direction by approximately 0.0062 units. Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.75 before extruding. **Step 5: Integrate the intermediate part with the previous CAD models** Combine the current part with the previous CAD models as a new, separate solid body. **Shape description:** - Shape: A rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and a curved side. - Length: Approximately 0.75 units. - Width: Approximately 0.0124 units. - Height: Approximately 0.75 units.</description>

prompt: <description>Part 1: Construct a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and a sloped side. Begin by creating a new coordinate system at (0, 0, 0) with no rotation. Create the first face of the sketch and draw a rectangle with the following lines: 1. Line 1: Start Point (0, 0), End Point (0.5, 0) 2. Line 2: Start Point (0.5, 0), End Point (0.5, 0.75) 3. Line 3: Start Point (0.5, 0.75), End Point (0, 0.75) 4. Line 4: Start Point (0, 0.75), End Point (0, 0) Set the sketch scaling factor to 0.75. Extrude the sketch vertically by 0.3 units to create the 3D model. Part 2: Construct a smaller rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. Create a new coordinate system at (0, 0, 0.3) with no rotation. Create a face on the XY plane and draw a rectangle with the following lines: 1. Line 1: Start Point (0, 0), End Point (0.15, 0) 2. Line 2: Start Point (0.15, 0), End Point (0.15, 0.75) 3. Line 3: Start Point (0.15, 0.75), End Point (0, 0.75) 4. Line 4: Start Point (0, 0.75), End Point (0, 0) Set the sketch scaling factor to 0.75. Extrude the sketch horizontally by 0.15 units in the negative Z direction to remove the material. Part 3: Construct a cylindrical object with a slightly tapered top and bottom. Create a new coordinate system at (0.225, 0.275, 0.3) with no rotation. Create a face on the XY plane and draw a circle with the following properties: 1. Circle 1: Center (0.1, 0.1), Radius 0.1 Set the sketch scaling factor to 0.2. Extrude the sketch horizontally by 1.25 units in the negative Z direction to remove the material. The combined 3D model represents a rectangular prism with a cylindrical hole in the center.</description>
